dt: {bc}the point of sharpest curvature in a path (such as that followed by a turning vehicle)

dt.t: a driver hitting the {wi}apex{/wi} as he races around a corner
At the {wi}apex{/wi} of the turn his rear wheels apparently came unstuck from the oil-drenched groove.

pt: {sc}summit{/sc} {sc}peak{/sc} {sc}pinnacle{/sc} {sc}climax{/sc} {sc}apex{/sc} {sc}acme{/sc} {sc}culmination{/sc} mean the highest point attained or attainable. {sc}summit{/sc} implies the topmost level attainable.

pt.t: at the {it}summit{/it} of the Victorian social scene

pt: {sc}peak{/sc} suggests the highest among other high points.

pt.t: an artist working at the {it}peak{/it} of her powers

pt: {sc}pinnacle{/sc} suggests a dizzying and often insecure height.
{sc}climax{/sc} implies the highest point in an ascending series.

pt.t: the war was the {it}climax{/it} to a series of hostile actions

pt: {sc}apex{/sc} implies the point where all ascending lines converge.
{sc}acme{/sc} implies a level of quality representing the perfection of a thing.

pt.t: a statue that was once deemed the {it}acme{/it} of beauty

pt: {sc}culmination{/sc} suggests the outcome of a growth or development representing an attained objective.

shortdef: the narrowed or pointed end : tip
